name: 10 Question Religion Quiz: Who am I? | Religious Figures

questions.text: Before I was chosen to be king, I watched my father's sheep. My best friend's name was Jonathan, but his father tried to kill me. I am most famous for killing a giant with a small stone. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
David.

	Jesse was the father of eight sons, including the youngest named David. Boaz was David's great grandfather and Obed was his grandfather. David died after a long reign at the age of seventy. His tomb is on Mount Zion. The story of David can be found in I and II Samuel.

questions.text: I was my father's first son. He and his wife didn't think they could have children so my mother gave him a son. When my father's wife had a child, my mother and I were sent away so she wouldn't have to look at me. God blessed me and I became the head of a nation. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Ishmael.

	Abraham was eighty-six when Ishmael was born. After Sarah had Isaac, she had Abraham send Hagar and Ishmael away. Hagar couldn't feed Ishmael so she left him to die, but God provided shelter and food for both of them and blessed both mother and son. Ishmael lived to be a hundred and thirty-seven years old and had twelve sons. The story of  Ishmael can be found in Genesis 21.

questions.text: I was raised by an Egyptian princess after she found me hidden in some bulrushes. When I was grown, I led the Israelites into the wilderness and away from Pharaoh. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Moses.

	God gave Moses the Ten Commandments while on Mount Sinai. After disobeying God's command, Moses was not allowed to enter the Holy Land so he looked at the land from Mount Nebo. Moses died at the age of one-hundred and twenty and was buried in Moab. The story of Moses can be found in Exodus 2.

questions.text: I was born because God promised my mother she would have a child. I grew up in the temple with a prophet named Eli. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Samuel.

	Samuel means "heard of God". He was the son of Hannah and Elkanah. He became a prophet and a king. Samuel was living in Ramah when God called him to Bethlehem to anoint Saul as king. He died in Ramah at the age of eighty. Samuel's story can be found in I and II Samuel.

questions.text: I became king at the age of eight. I devoted myself to getting rid of idols when I was sixteen. While restoring the temple, my people found the Pentateuch written by Moses. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Josiah.

	Josiah became king after his father, Amon, died. After reading the Pentateuch, Josiah had his people celebrate Passover. Josiah died after going into battle disguised. Jeremiah read Josiah's funeral eulogy and listed him as one of the best kings of Israel. The story of Josiah can be found in 2 Kings 22.

questions.text: I left my husband to become Felix's wife. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Drusilla.

	Drusilla was the youngest of Herod Agrippa's three daughters. She was married to the king of Emesa who was called Azizus until Felix convinced her to leave him. She was with Felix when Paul went before the judge. Drusilla's story can be found in Acts 24:24.

questions.text: An angel told me I was going to have a baby, but I had never been with a man or even been married. I gave birth in a Bethlehem stable. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Mary.

	Mary and Joseph married and went to Bethlehem so Joseph could pay his taxes. It was there that Mary delivered a baby boy they named Jesus. Even though Mary has been known as the Virgin Mary, the two words aren't together in the Bible. Mary's story can be found in the gospels of Matthew 1:23, Mark 6:3, and Luke 2:1-20.

questions.text: I was just a simple Jewish girl when I was chosen to be the new queen of Persia. My cousin made me promise to hide my faith from my new husband. Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Esther.

	Esther kept her family and friends from being killed after exposing a plot by her husband's right-hand man. After the plot was exposed, Esther proclaimed to her husband that she was Jewish. The story of Esther can be found in the book of Esther.

questions.text: My marriage was declared as unlawful by a man of God and he was thrown into prison and beheaded because of what he said.
questions.explanation:
Herodias.

	Herodias is the daughter of Aristobulus and Bernice. When John the Baptist declared that she and Herod Philip I were not truly married, Herodias' brother-in-law threw John into prison and later had him beaheaded. Herodias' story can be found in Matthew 14:3-11, Mark 6:17-28, and Luke 3:19.

questions.text: My husband and I lived in a beautiful garden before we were thrown out for disobeying. My first born son killed his younger brother out of jealousy. Did I also mention that I was the first woman? Who am I?
questions.explanation:
Eve.

	Eve disobeyed God by eating the fruit from the Tree of Good and Evil. Because of her disobedience, she and her husband were thrown out of the Garden and she was doomed to have pain during childbirth. The Bible accounts for three of Eve's sons: Cain, Abel, and Seth. Eve's story can be found in Genesis 3.
